results.title: Four weddings and a funeral
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Duncan Kenworthy, Channel Four, PolyGram and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: This charming and quirky British romantic comedy stars Hugh Grant and Andy Macdowell as the two lovers who belong together…perhaps! An excellent cast, including an hilarious cameo by Rowan Atkinson as the tongued-tied vicar, “Four weddings & a funeral” is unashamedly sentimental, but at the same time reveals not only the “funny side” of relationships, but their fragility. As Hugh Grant catapaults from one emotional and social disaster to another, due to an excess of good manners and a very British tendency towards “keeping a stiff upper lip”, he eventually discovers that the course of true love diverges from his expected course down the altar.

results.title: Forgotten silver
results.creator_credit: Costa Botes, Peter Jackson, Sue Rodgers, New Zealand Film Commission, New Zealand On Air and Wingnut Films
results.brief_description: Made in part to celebrate 100 years of cinema, this startling documentary first aired on New Zealand television. When New Zealand film director Peter Jackson stumbles upon an old trunk of nitrate films in a backyard shed, it appears that he has uncovered a lost chapter in New Zealand film history. His discovery leads him to Colin McKenzie, an extraordinary New Zealand born film pioneer and avid inventor from the early 1900s. Jackson’s research reveals that McKenzie was responsible for developing many cinematic innovations including colour film, sync sound and tracking shots that had long been attributed to more famous motion picture pioneers. McKenzie also risked his life to make a silent biblical epic ‘Salome’ in remote bush on the West Coast of the South Island. As Jackson turns up more amazing facts about the McKenzie legacy, it gradually becomes apparent that his documentary is a meticulously staged hoax. The ‘mockumentary’ combines interviews with real people such as actor Sam Neill, film critic Leonard Maltin and Miramax Chairman Harvey Weinstein, with elaborately faked, utterly convincing silent film footage, still photographs and other archival material. Jackson and Botes’ film is a clever, slightly deranged parody of the earnest documentary tributes to the centenary of cinema that were being made at the time. When it first aired on New Zealand television it sparked a minor controversy, enraging viewers who had been duped into believing it was about a real historical subject.

results.title: Foothold on Antarctica
results.creator_credit: James Carr, British Information Services and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: As a preliminary to the crossing of the Antarctic continent by Sir Vivian Fuchs and his party, an advance group set out from London in the m.v. “Theron”, a Canadian sealing vessel, to establish a base camp. Her month long struggle with the pack ice of the Weddell Sea captured the attention of the world. This film, a record of that journey, received Honourable Mention at the International Festival of Documentary and Expeprimental Cinema, Montevideo, 1958.

results.title: Fetishes
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Broomfield, Michele D'Acosta and Home Box Office
results.brief_description: Pandora’s Box is an exclusive high class S & M parlour in Manhattan. Mistress Raven - previously a Long Island housewife, became New York’s most famous mistress and later retired to become the founder of Pandora’s Box. The documentary covers the functions of her parlour and various aspects of S & M; corporal punishment, whipping/slapping, wrestling fetish, rubber fetish, infantilism, slaves, humiliation, mistresses etc. The documentary provides insights into the personal aspirations of Raven’s crew of dominatrix (Mistress Natasha, Catherine, and Delilah) with vivid footage of the parlour in operation.

results.title: Escape from Sobibor
results.creator_credit: Jack Gold, Dennis E. Doty, Rule-Starger Productions and Zenith Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Richard Rashke, and unpublished manuscripts From the ashes of Sobibor” by Thomas Blatt and “Inferno in Sobibor by Stanislaw Szmajzner, this made for television (originally as a miniseries) drama tells the true story of a heroic escape by Jewish prisoners in the Nazi death camp in the forests of Sobibor, a Polish village, in October 1943. During the camp’s operation from May 1942 to October 1943, approximately 250,000 Polish and Russian Jews were exterminated in the five gas chambers - only the skilled survived to work as labourers under the watchful and often brutal Nazi guards. But even those who did survive knew they were on borrowed time. Escape was the only answer. The traumatised prisoners, led by Leon Feldhendler (Alan Arkin) along with the support of the prisoners of war Russian soldiers under the command of Alexander Percherski (Rutger Hauer), hatch a fantastic plan of escape. However, this ambitious plan is not just for a handful of prisoners, it is a chance for all 600 prisoners to make a bid for freedom and survival. This uprising proved to be the largest and most successful of its kind during World War II. For forty years the world was unaware of the events - the Nazis destroyed the camp and all of its records in a cover-up by burning it to the ground. An intense human drama displaying some of the brutality, but also the determination, spirit and courage of those who survived the Holocaust and this most amazing escape. Cast also includes Joanna Pacula, Hartmut Becker, Simon Gregor and Jack Shepherd.

results.title: Edvard Munch
results.creator_credit: Peter Watkins, Norsk Rikskringkasting and Sveriges Radio
results.brief_description: Watkin’s portrayal of the life and work of the pioneer Norwegian expressionist painter and graphic artist Edvard Munch (1863-1908), combines quasi-documentary and period drama, incorporating meticulous detail to place the artist in a social and historical context. The use of non-professional actors, often communicating directly with the audience by glances into the camera, adds to the immediacy of the dialogue which was written in collaboration with the cast. The resulting film takes the viewer to the heart of the artistic temperament and to the very core of the creative process. In Norwegian and German dialogue with English narration and subtitles. Cast includes Geir Westby and Gro Fraas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Watkins, Norsk Rikskringkasting and Sveriges Radio

results.title: Educating Rita
results.creator_credit: Lewis Gilbert, Acorn Films and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the play of the same name by Willy Russell. Frank, a cynical and drunken professor of literature is appalled and then amused by the quest for knowledge and culture of one of his new students, a hairdresser named Rita. Frank soon finds that Rita has more zest for life and more natural intelligence than most of his “educated students”. Features Michael Caine and Julie Walters.

results.title: Eat the rich
results.creator_credit: Peter Richardson, Tim Van Rellim and Ironfist Pictures
results.brief_description: From the makers of the “Comic strip” and the “Young Ones”, this black and often tasteless comedy is certain to startle. Alex, a black waiter at a celebrated restaurant for the rich called “Bastards”, is sacked. Determined to wreak revenge, he organises a people’s take over and captures the restaurant. Renaming it “Eat the Rich”, Alex and his friends serve up their own special brand of millionaires mince. Not for the faint-hearted and with a heavy metal soundtrack by Motorhead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Richardson, Tim Van Rellim and Ironfist Pictures

results.title: Duran Duran
results.creator_credit: Russell Mulcahy and Educational Media International
results.brief_description: A collection of Duran Duran first eleven videotapes. Two of the clips “Girls on film” and “Chauffeur” contain material which would have a theatrical “M” rating. Adult preview recommended.

results.title: Dough and dynamite
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Mack Sennett and Keystone Film Company
results.brief_description: A Charlie Chaplin comedy concerning labor trouble in a bakehouse. Slapstick comedy at its best. Cast includes Chester Conklin, Charley Chase, Edgar Kennedy, Slim Summerville.
